Workflow management

Source: vignettes/07_worklow_management.Rmd
07_worklow_management.Rmd

The API design of mbtools makes it well suited for workflow managers. This is particularly useful when you have longer analysis chains. For instance, let’s look at an example workflow. We start with the config:

library(mbtools)
## Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'ggplot2':
##   method         from 
##   [.quosures     rlang
##   c.quosures     rlang
##   print.quosures rlang
## Also loading:
##   - dada2=1.12.1
##   - data.table=1.12.2
##   - ggplot2=3.1.1
##   - magrittr=1.5
##   - phyloseq=1.28.0
##   - ShortRead=1.42.0
##   - yaml=2.2.0
## Found tools:
##   - minimap2=2.15-r905
##   - slimm=0.3.4
##   - samtools=1.9
## 
## Attaching package: 'mbtools'
## The following object is masked _by_ 'package:BiocGenerics':
## 
##     normalize
ref <- system.file("extdata/genomes/zymo_mock.fna.gz", package = "mbtools")
reads <- system.file("extdata/nanopore", package = "mbtools")

config <- list(
    preprocess = config_preprocess(
        trimLeft = 10,
        maxEE = 500,
        maxN = 4,
        out_dir = "preprocessed"
    ),
    align = config_align(
        reference = ref,
        alignment_dir = "alignments",
        threads = 4
    ),
    count = config_count(
        reference = ref,
        weights = TRUE,
        maxit = 1000,
        threads = 4
    )
)

Where our actual workflow looks like this:

counting <- find_read_files(reads) %>% 
            quality_control(min_score = 20) %>%
            preprocess(config$preprocess) %>%
            align_long_reads(config$align) %>%
            count_references(config$count)

This looks pretty clear but it will run the entire workflow everytime we execute the code. This is particularly costly if we only want to change some parameters of the last step. For instance to check what the effect of weighting on counting is.

In this case we don’t need to run preprocessing and aligning again. We could implement this with several if-statements and by saving the immediate outputs but this makes the code way more convoluted. Also this would not tell us if the input files changed.

Workflow management with drake

One popular workflow manager for R is drake which will automatically track what needs to be recomputed and what not. This requires only minimal changes to mbtools workflows, mostly wrapping all input and output location with file_in and file_out.

library(drake)
## 
## Attaching package: 'drake'
## The following object is masked from 'package:ShortRead':
## 
##     clean
## The following object is masked from 'package:S4Vectors':
## 
##     expand
reads <- file_in("../inst/extdata/nanopore")
config$preprocess$out_dir <- file_out("preprocessed")
config$align$alignment_dir <- file_out("alignment_dir")

plan <- drake_plan(
    files = find_read_files(reads),
    qa = quality_control(files, min_score = 20),
    qual_plot = ggsave(file_out("quals.png"), qa$quality_plot),
    processed = preprocess(files, trimLeft = 10, maxEE = 1000, maxN = 10,
                           threads = 4, out_dir = file_out("preprocessed")),
    aligned = align_short_reads(processed, reference = ref,
                                alignment_dir = file_out("alignments"),
                                threads = 4),
    counting = count_references(aligned, reference = ref, weights = TRUE,
                                maxit = 1000, threads = 4)
)

We can take a look if our plan makes sense:

clean()
dconf <- drake_config(plan)
vis_drake_graph(dconf)

As we see drake knows we have to run everything. Let’s execute the plan and see what happens.

make(plan, lock_envir = FALSE)
## target files
## target qa
## INFO [2019-05-27 15:57:08] Running quality assay for forward reads from 3 files.
## INFO [2019-05-27 15:57:21] Median per base error is 12.589% (median score = 9.00).
## INFO [2019-05-27 15:57:21] Mean per cycle entropy is 1.578 (in [0, 2]).
## INFO [2019-05-27 15:57:21] On average we have 1000.00 +- 0.00 reads per file.
## target processed
## INFO [2019-05-27 15:57:25] Preprocessing reads for 3 single-end samples...
## INFO [2019-05-27 15:57:26] 593/3e+03 (19.77%) reads passed preprocessing.
## Target processed messages:
##   Creating output directory: preprocessed
## target qual_plot
## Target qual_plot messages:
##   Saving 7.29 x 4.51 in image
## target aligned
## INFO [2019-05-27 15:57:31] Creating output directory alignments.
## INFO [2019-05-27 15:57:31] Aligning 3 samples on 4 threads. Keeping up to 100 secondary alignments.
## INFO [2019-05-27 15:57:32] Finished aligning even1.
## INFO [2019-05-27 15:57:34] Finished aligning even2.
## INFO [2019-05-27 15:57:36] Finished aligning even3.
## target counting
## INFO [2019-05-27 15:57:36] Getting reference lengths from /home/cdiener/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/3.6/mbtools/extdata/genomes/zymo_mock.fna.gz...
## INFO [2019-05-27 15:57:37] Normalized IDs. Starting counting...

Now if we check our plan…

vis_drake_graph(dconf)

We see that evrything is up-to-date. Now if we only cha
